Shiavalae-Amarathar.name: Shiavalae Amarathar
Shiavalae-Amarathar.quote: "One's ability to express themselves thru the arcane arts is as varied as any other art form. I find that the most effective type of magical techniques are those that resolve issues without the need for the cruder, baser forms of magical expression; evocation magic for example."
description: Shiavalae Amarathar is a young, elf adventurer and member of Ruby Phoenix, a well known adventuring guild operating out of Rakenburg. Only a young adult by elven standards, Shia speaks with a relatively meek demeanor, though she can be excitable when in the presence of interesting mystical or arcane phenomena. She is of average height and build for an elf, with distinctive blue hair.

She is a Wizard specializing in Abjuration magic. While in a discussion with Erlinder, Shia revealed that she does not really know her parents, who apparently chose to leave her under the tutelage of the wizards of the Tower of Stantorr in Frecyra. She appeared to still be coming to terms with this sense of abandonment.

Shia met the Adventurers during a chance encounter at the gates of the Palace of Akad the Magnificent, the Efreet lord. While exploring the interior together, Khazar Thul, Shiavalae and the the Adventurers encountered the shade of Akad and were bound to his service.

Khazar-Thul.name: Khazar Thul
Khazar-Thul.quote: "I am humble servant of the Eternal Flame. He guides me in the darkest places where there is no hope, honor or virtue to be found. Not all pay homage to his glorious visage, but all are touched by his grace."
description: Khazar Thul is a seasoned human adventurer and a devout follower of the Eternal. Exceptionally tall, standing roughly 6ft 8in (2 meters), with a muscular physique, he prefers to enter the thick of the fighting in order to dispatch his foes with his two-handed sword.

Khazar has braved many dangerous locations during his time as a professional adventurer. Over the course of his adventures, he has acquired a number of helpful tools that he employs when a situation calls for it, such as Jozara's Claw of Acuity.
He has gained a keen eye for character and is a stalwart ally to those he feels are worthy of his friendship.
As part of his religious devotion, Khazar can be found praying towards the sunrise every morning.

Khazar met the Adventurers during a chance encounter at the gates of the Palace of Akad, the Efreet lord. While exploring the interior together, Khazar, Shia and the Adventurers encountered the shade of Akad and were bound to his service.

Jeskin-Sebroski.name: Jeskin Sebroski
description: As the Count of Szary, Jeskin Sebroski is both the local lord, administrator, and commander of a feudal county bordering the state of Tovanis. The count takes his role as the ruler of a border province very seriously, knowing that he is the first line of defense against incursions from foreign states, and monstrous creatures from beyond his borders.
A man of noble birth, Count Sebroski was tutored from a young age in the arts of riding, warfare, court life and hunting.

As a member of the nobility of the Kingdom of Navolin, Jeskin was brought into the ranks of the Hussars and excelled during the dangerous training regime that all initiates must undergo. He has since risen through the ranks to become one of the commanding officers of the order.

He is a common sight in the court of King Kzesimir III in Frecyra where he is called up on to provide military advice. He is also a close personal friend of Prince Aronas Czak and returned from a provincial issue in the village of Rythlon upon learning the news of the prince's death.

Kzesimir-III-of-House-Czak.name: Kzesimir III of House Czak
description: King Kzesimir III is the monarch of Navolin and head of the noble Czak House. His court is held in Frecyra at the Palace of the Western Wind.

Akad-the-Magnificent.name: Akad the Magnificent
Akad-the-Magnificent.titles: the Magnificent, Lord of the Molten Baths
Akad-the-Magnificent.quote: "Welcome, welcome! You have entered the Halls of Akad the Magnificent. Are they, am I, not glorious?"
description: Akad the Magnificent was an Efreet who ruled a region south of the Jordonis Mountians thousands of years ago. His palace, a fabulous complex made of brass and black stone known as the Molten Halls, was the seat of his power when he resided on the Material Plane. While he ruled the area, Akad demanded tribute from all under his dominion and bound many beings to his service. He would store his treasures in a pool of super-heated mercury, in which he enslaved several Azer, including Uster and Tyda, to guard and act as valets.
He was banished back to the City of Brass by a pair of wizards, Menodora & Amabilis.
While exploring the interior of the Molten Palace, Khazar, Shia and the the Adventurers encountered the shade of Akad and were bound to his service.

Lirr-Stonebreath.name: Lirr Stonebreath
description: A young dwarf cleric of the Maker, Lirr Stonebreath set out from the Dwarf Hold of Felrast on her journey to find the masters of her craft. Disguising herself as a man in order to avoid others looking down upon her as a smith, Lirr hitched a ride on a merchant wagon heading east, which was being guarded by Roland of Zelmar.

While on the border of Tovanis and Navolin, Lirr and Roland encountered a young halfling named Filibert. After a series of events outside of Auburn Castle, the three traveled together to the village of Rythlon on the Sulas river.

While in Rythlon, Lirr and the Adventurers took on a job to help a local butcher, Lormin Blackmaw, who was hoping to save his friend from a curse. After overcoming monsters and traps in a cave complex, the group succeeded in removing the curse.
This series of events left Lirr shaken and after some consideration she decided to continue her journey to Kazdan Ord by herself over staying in Rythlon to help resolve the locals' issues.

the-Myrd'draal.name: the Myrd'draal
the-Myrd'draal.quote: "You have traveled far and seen much of the world. Now it is time for me to open your eyes to the truths of this universe."
description: The Myrd'draal is an elder Eladrin female and the Grand Master of the Order of the Endless Sky. She resides at Kongir Temple and currently is in possession of the Belt of the Masters.

Roland-of-Zelmar.name: Roland of Zelmar
Roland-of-Zelmar.quote: "Greetings, lord baron. I believe this creature was terrorizing your woodlands. I presume there is a bounty for its head?"
description: A monster hunter by trade, Roland of Zelmar is a quiet, but insightful man. Tall, with broad shoulders, and a graying beard and hair, Roland wears black studded leather armor. His most distinctive trait is his orange eyes, which have pupils like that of a lizard or cat.

He traveled to Felrast, a dwarf hold nestled in the Pillars of Amud in order to have Ithi Ironjaw, a legendary Master Runesmith, forge him a unique bastard sword etched with dwarven runes. After the work was completed, Roland left Felrast, taking a job as a guard for a merchant wagon. It was during this journey that he befriended Lirr Stonebreath.

While on the border of Tovanis and Navolin, Lirr and Roland encountered a young halfling named Filibert. After a series of events outside of Auburn Castle, the three traveled together to the village of Rythlon on the Sulas river.

Roland traveled with Filibert to several local manors trying to help the young fighter find a new lord who might employ him, but to no avail. With Filibert returning to Rythlon to being a career as an adventurer, Roland continued his journey north towards the city of Zelmar in northern Navolin.

Mysterious-Monk.name: Mysterious Monk
Mysterious-Monk.quote: "Come, boy who plays with sticks. We shall meet again at Kongir. I await your arrival."
description: This strange human monk was first encountered by the Adventurers in the town of Relysburg on the eastern border of Navolin. He was seen following behind another man, Sharif Tehrani. His eyes had no pupils and his head was shaved to reveal a tattoo of an arcane eye in the center of forehead. The tattoo depicts the eye billowing smoke over his right ear and down the back of his neck.

When he passed the monk, Murat noticed that the Staff of the Summit pulled slightly toward the man. Murat decided to investigate and followed the monk and his companion into the town stable where they were purchasing horses. Murat set his staff down in front of the monk, attempting to discern the source of the strange magical attraction from the staff. Unfortunately, the monk then proceeded to snatch Murat's staff from the group with unexpected speed and fled the town.

The adventurers gave chase, but were unable to catch the mysterious monk, only managing to subdue Sharif. They then tracked the monk through a canyon east of Relysburg, but the monk was too fast and eventually escaped their pursuit by climbing the face of a waterfall. Before he left, the monk shouted out a challenge to Murat and declared he hoped they would meet again at Kongir Temple.

Zorrakir.name: Zorrakir
Zorrakir.quote: "You say you are not a wizard, but you are doing a very bad job of convincing me otherwise."
description: Zorrakir is an wandering tiefling monk. He has pale, mauve skin, with long, gray hair which is always tied in a bun behind his curved, ram-like horns. He keeps a long, unkempt beard, which he never bothers to tame or bind. He is rather tall and lean for a tiefling, though his constant drinking has resulted in a paunch. He has piercing red eyes that seem to almost glow.

Murat met Zorrakir in Zurast, the capital city of the Archduchy. A gang of thugs had decided to attempt to rob the old man, and much to their surprise, the drunk old tiefling beat them mercilessly without dropping his wineskin. After witnessing this, Murat followed the old monk around for days, demanding that he teach him how to fight as he had. After several days of attempting to avoid the half-orc, Zorrakir relented and offered to train Murat.

The last time Murat or Evan-Jakob saw Zorrakir was a mountain-side temple outside of Tarona, when a mysterious darkness overtook the temple and several strange, glowing suits of armor emerged. Zorrakir told the others to run as he went about combating the creatures, throwing Murat his staff in the process.
The old tiefling told the men to meet him at the city of Venbrin.

Imizael-Clathara.name: Imizael Clathara
Imizael-Clathara.quote: "I am a simle shepard. My favorite place is here, with my flock. However, someone in this village needs to teach the people to defend themselves, and it appears that I am the only one who can manage that right now."
description: Imizael is the new steward of Rythlon and was previously the village's militia commander. She is of average height, with an athletic, graceful build. She has long, dark hair which she keeps braided on one side. In combat, she fights with two short swords, which she uses with the speed and skill of someone who has practiced swordplay for decades.

She was promoted to the position of steward after Alderman Selif Koric was relieved of the role by Count Jeskin Sebroski, following the revelation that magistrate Teliril Wasanathi was a Hag terrorizing Rythlon for months. It was only after the Adventurers intervened into the situation, saving the town from Teliril's dark designs, that the Count recognized what Imizael had been doing for the village and decided she might serve the people better than the selfish and inept Alderman.

When she is not training the militia or taking care of official duties in the village, she cares for a flock of sheep at her farm on the north side of the village inside the palisade. Some nights she can be found at the Moody Acrobat, drinking wine and playing cards with her friend Edmund the stable hand.

Bordin.name: Bordin
Bordin.quote: "It's been a gloomy year, gentlemen. Ever since the new magistrate showed up, everyone has been on edge. I just keep to myself here and not to ask too many questions. I don't want to get on anyone's bad side. Anyway, what can I get you all to drink?"
description: Bordin is the large, bearded, portly owner and innkeeper of the Moody Acrobat, the only inn/tavern in the village of Rythlon. Generally jovial and good natured, Bordin has been running the inn for many years. The Moody Acrobat is frequented by locals, but rarely has guests who stay for any extended period.
His cousin, Davrik, ran Green Boat shipping, the largest business in Rythlon. With Davrik's arrest for smuggling illegal goods into Rythlon, Bordin has taken temporary ownership of the company.

Davrik.name: Davrik
description: Davrik is a the owner and operator of Green Boat Shipping, a merchant shipping company that operates out of Rythlon and transports goods up and down the Sulas river. A human man, Davrik is the cousin of Bordin, the innkeeper of the Moody Acrobat.

Green Boat Shipping is the largest business in the village, though Davrik had plans to expand its operations further abroad. In order to do so, he had borrowed money from Yora, a local moneylender, in order to expand the business. When his plans did not get the expected returns quickly enough, Davrik was forced to find other ways of making money in order pay off his debts.

The Adventurers first encountered Davrik and some of his employees one night on the banks of the Sulas while investigating strange noises that the villagers heard coming from the river at night. They soon realized that the noises were actually those of the men smuggling goods upriver at night and offloading them at a small dock downriver from Rythlon. After a quick scuffle, the Adventurers subdued the men and brought them back to the village for judgment from the alderman, Selif Koric.

Koric, who seemed unwilling to punish the men, was forced to seek the input of Count Jeskin Sebroski at Castle Grinsted after the surprise arrival of Teliril Wasanathi at his manor. This interlude provided the Adventurers time to further investigate the strange happenings in the village in an attempt to save Davrik and Gregor from possible execution.

After Teliril was revealed to be a hag who had been manipulating and terrorizing the village for her own gain, Count Jeskin chose to reduce the sentences of the smugglers to six months of hard labor instead of a capital punishment.

Gregor.name: Gregor
description: Gregor is a human man who works for Davrik as an employee of Green Boat Shipping. He was one of several men that joined his boss in smuggling illicit cargo to Rythlon on the Sulas river. After being captured by the Adventurers while smuggling goods, he was brought before Alderman Selif Koric for judgment.

Koric, who seemed unwilling to punish the men, was forced to seek the input of Count Jeskin Sebroski at Castle Grinsted after the unexpected arrival of Teliril Wasanathi at his manor. This interlude provided the Adventurers time to further investigate the strange happenings in the village in an attempt to save Davrik and Gregor from possible execution.

After Teliril was revealed to be a hag who had been manipulating and terrorizing the village for her own gain, Count Jeskin chose to reduce the sentences of the smugglers to six months of hard labor instead of a capital punishment.

Teliril-Wasanathi.name: Teliril Wasanathi
description: Teliril Wasanathi was a beautiful female elf magistrate who had been assigned to oversee the village of Rythlon in Navolin. She had pale skin, platinum blond hair and golden eyes. Aloof, calculating and sadistic, the elf magistrate had arrived in the village less than a year before the Adventurers arrived, but in that time she had overseen at least twelve executions for crimes in the village.

After the Adventurers drove off a small incursion of shadowy creatures at the Moody Acrobat, word spread around the village of their deed and upon their return from grotto outside of town, Teliril came to size up the new arrivals. After several of the Adventurers failed at flirting with her, it became clear that she has not a friendly face in town.

Later, when the Adventurers returned from the banks of the Sulas with Davrik and Gregor, Teliril appeared at the manor of Alderman Selif Koric only minutes after the group arrived to determine what to do with the smugglers. Teliril demanded that the two men face the harshest possible punishment for their crimes, causing the alderman to leave the village to consult with Count Jeskin Sebroski.

When the Adventurers arrived back from the Thornroot Thicket with the corpse of the Lady in the Woods, Teliril cast Raise Dead on the body in order to cast even more doubt upon the group. However, the spell was ineffective due to the intervention of Reanold Duplechin.

When the Adventurers were put on trial in front of the count, Erlinder, sensing that Teliril's appearance was an illusion, grabbed hold of the Hag's invisible claw, leading to a battle in the courtroom. Upon revealing her true form, the Adventurers and Count Jeskin took up arms against her. She spent her last moments, before being cut down by Filibert, madly attempting to kill Erlinder for unveiling her true form and ruining her plans.

Lormin-Blackmaw.name: Lormin Blackmaw
description: Lormin Blackmaw is the half-orc butcher of Rythlon. His shop, the Lazy Goat, is located near the center of the village, just outside the village square. Before settling down in the village, Lormin lived the life of an adventurer along with his friend Rakas of Driskal. He is a sly, well-mannered man who still remembers his glory days of delving dungeons, fighting monsters and uncovering ancient treasures.

When the Adventurers first came to Rythlon, Lormin witnessed them fend off a small incursion of shadowy creatures at the Moody Acrobat. He quietly approached them, hoping that they might be interested in helping him remove a curse from Rakas. The two men had ventured into a cave system they heard held ruins and in the process Rakas had been afflicted with a mysterious ailment. The adventurers agreed and upon completing the task, Lormin paid them 100 gold pieces for their help.

Edmund.name: Edmund
description: Edmund is a young halfling man who makes a living as a stable hand for various stables and farms around the village of Rythlon. He is friends with Imizael Clathara and can be found most nights at the Moody Acrobat playing cards with Imizael and other gamblers. Erlinder took note that Lormin Blackmaw has a tendency to keep an eye on Edmund when he is at the Moody Acrobat.
The Adventurers purchased Muffin from Edmund before leaving Rythlon on their way to Volikgrad.

Rakas-of-Driskal.name: Rakas of Driskal
description: A friar who presides over the Temple of the Guardian in Rythlon, Rakas of Driskal is a devout follower of his chosen deity. Rakas is a large, bearded man in his mid-fifties who spends his days caring for the small temple and cemetery of the village. He can occasionally be found having a drink with his friends Lormin & Priceli, the local butcher, at the Moody Acrobat.

The Adventurers encountered Rakas while investigating the curse he was afflicted with. He seemed unaware that he was cursed, instead assuming it was an illness of some sort. After the adventurers cleansed the cauldron belonging to the hags of the grotto, the curse was lifted. Rakas, however, was unaware of this and assumed he had instead been cured of his 'illness' by the Guardian. The Adventurers chose not to correct him, leaving him to his worship.

Muffin.name: Muffin
description: Muffin is a pack mule that the Adventurers purchased from Edmund the stable hand before leaving Rythlon on their way to Volikgrad. Erlinder will occasionally use Speak with Animals to converse with Muffin, who is generally rude and terse with the druid.

When the Adventurers ventured inside the Molten Halls, they left Muffin outside to graze. When they emerged from the halls, Muffin was loaded with thousands of copper coins that the group had found and was made to carry the coins to Volikgrad for exchange into more usable currency. She was then brought along on the Salty Ferret as the Adventurers traveled on to Rakenburg.

Vythica-Floshin.name: Vythica Floshin
Vythica-Floshin.quote: "It's been quite a while since I had a visitor. Please, come in. We can have some tea and chat."
description: Vythica Floshin is a half-elf woman who resides by herself in a large stone house in Rythlon. A wizard of some manner, the Adventurers encountered her when Murat wished to have his master's staff identified. She offered to do so in exchange for him helping her clean up her library; a task Murat to do rather poorly. Though she attempted to engage Murat in further pleasantries, the monk was quick to leave her house after she identified the staff, leaving her dejected at the rare chance for company.

Reanold-Duplechin.name: Reanold Duplechin
Reanold-Duplechin.quote: "Les gar make yourselves at home! Sit yourself down at my table. Have a seat, kick up your feet. I'll tell your future if I am able..."
description: Reanold Duplechin is a wandering merchant who arrived in Rythlon during the Adventurers' altercations with Teliril Wasanathi.

He is of average height for a halfling, with a dark complexion and gaudy clothing. Around his neck is a silver chain with a bird skull looped through it. He drives an ostentatious wagon, on which he mounts various symbols of the occult, along with a staggering number of raven skulls. When asked where he is from, Reanold first responded that was 'not from around here', but after becoming more friendly with the Adventurers, he revealed he was from a place he referred to as 'Maison du Corbeau'.

At first, the halfling simply saw the group as a way to earn some coin, selling them several minor magical items in exchange for some coin and a favor. However, following the group's return to Rythlon after killing the Lady of the Wood, Reanold intervened when Teliril cast Raise Dead on the hag's corpse. Using his Bardic talents, Reanold severed the magical tethers that were animating the corpse, allowing the Adventurers a change to prove their innocence to Count Jeskin Sebroski.

After the completion of the trial and the death of Teliril, Reanold called upon Filibert to complete his bargain and sent the group off to look for his assistant, Leiana, who had run off with a magical figurine that Reanold uses to summon the horses that pull his wagon. The woman had last been seen at a place called 'the Bone Mill' north of the village. The only sign of the woman was scraps of a red cloak and drag marks inside the mill. With Leiana nowhere to be seen, the group returned with the figurine, completing Reanold's request.

Selif-Koric.name: Selif Koric
description: Previously the Alderman of Rythlon, Selif Koric is an elderly man who lived in a house on the village square. He has long, grey hair, a well kept bear and a dull, passive demeanor. Seemingly either inept or corrupt, Koric appeared to be generally uninterested in the plight of the people in Rythlon under the watchful eye of Teliril Wasanathi.

He first encountered the Adventurers when they brought Davrik and Gregor to his house in the middle of the night, after the men had been captured smuggling goods on the Sulas river. Koric seemed uninterested in the issue until Teliril arrived at his house and demanded the men be punished to the fullest extent of the law. Unwilling to issue a capital sentence on the spot, the alderman instead chose to travel to Castle Grinsted, the seat of Count Jeskin Sebroski, Koric's liege, in order to avoid having to make the judgement himself. This action allowed the adventurers time to investigate the issue further, as they suspected there were sinister forces at work in the village.

Koric would later return from Castle Grinsted with the count, who wished to deal with the issues in Rythlon personally. After the adventurers returned with evidence against Teliril, and a trial-turned-battle, the Count Jeskin decided to remove Koric from his position in favor of Imizael Clathara, who had showed herself to be a more suitable individual for the role of steward of Rythlon.
It is not clear what Koric would do with himself after his dismissal from the position of Alderman.

Nikodim-Tifafi-Zihan-Pilkozz.name: Nikodim Tifafi Zihan Pilkozz
Nikodim-Tifafi-Zihan-Pilkozz.quote: "Nobody said anything about a flaming dwarf coming aboard. You're going to owe me for the scorch marks."
description: The captain of the Salty Ferret, Nikodim Tifafi Zihan Pilkozz, better known as Captain Niko, is a flamboyant gnome who was hired by Shia to transport the Adventurers, herself and Khazar from Volikgrad to Rakenburg. Far easier to read than he believes, the Adventurers were quickly able to discern that Niko was not on the level, but it was not clear exactly what the gnome was up to.

After a salvage mission gone awry, the captain and the Adventurers battled an Icebrine Serpent. Following the battle, the Adventurers grew even more suspicious, due to Erlinder's knowledge of the serpent's diet. Unknown to the captain, Erlinder transformed into a spider and searched the ship, discovering that the captain and his crew were smuggling 20 blue dragon eggs, and were using the transport of the Adventurers as cover.
Following their successful arrival in Rakenburg, the captain offered his interest in providing further transportation services to the Adventurers if they required it.

Uster.name: Uster
description: Uster is one of two Azer slaves in the service of Akad the Magnificent in the Molten Halls. He was bound, along with Tyda, to serve as the Efreet's valets in the Mercury Vault. It was not clear exactly how long the two Azer had been left waiting in the Mercury Vault before the Adventurers, Shia and Khazar came upon them while exploring.
After the Adventurers struck a deal with Akad, Uster's service was transfered to Erlinder, to whom he was bound until the druid dispelled the magic while the group was in Rakenburg.
Uster is only able to speak in Ignan, a fact that makes it very difficult for him to communicate in any manner beyond grunts and gestures with anyone not from his home.

Priceli-Nezella-Philyorin.name: Priceli Nezella Philyorin
description: Priceli is a female gnome apothecary who runs the the Trusty Elixir, the local herbalist shop in Rythlon. She is of average height, with bright red hair. Her usual attire is bright clothing and various pieces of gold jewelry. She is an excitable woman, as gnomes tend to be, and is happy to engage other villagers or travelers in lively discussions, especially on the topics of plants, herbs and elixirs.
She is friends with Rakas and Lormin, whom she regularly has drinks with at the Moody Acrobat. She also provides Bordin, the innkeeper, with spices for the food at the inn.

Ithi-Ironjaw.name: Ithi Ironjaw
description: Ithi Ironjaw is a master runesmith. She is famous throughout Ulfwyst for her mastery of the art of Runesmithing. Most runesmiths are considered a master of their craft after learning to forge ten runes, at least one of which needs to be a Master Rune. Master Ironjaw is said to know at least 16 runes, including 5 Master Runes.

While traveling from Auburn Castle, Filibert and Lirr spoke at length with Roland of Zelmar about this new bastard sword which he had forged in Felrast. Roland shared the story of his journey with the adventurers and explained why he sought out Master Ironjaw to forge him this new blade.

Vagnur-Mountainhall.name: Vagnur Mountainhall
description: Vagnur Mountainhall is one of the oldest Runesmiths in Ulfwyst. He manages an age-old workshop in the Dwarven Hold of Kazdan Ord, in the Jordonis Mountains. He rarely, if ever, leaves the hold. Speaking directly to the master is difficult, as his students and underlings will go to great lengths to keep prospective clients from speaking to their master unless they feel the request is worthy of Master Mountainhall's attention.

Temperamental and surly, the old runesmith spends most of his time passing on his craft to younger smiths he feels show promise in the art. He recently accepted Lirr Stonebreath as an apprentice, after she expressed interest in the art-form and passed a series of trials to prove she was worthy of the venerable dwarf's time.

Vyslos.name: Vyslos
description: Erlinder first encountered Vyslos when the Adventuerers returned to the Thornroot Thicket after defeating Teliril Wasanathi in Rythlon. Wishing to use this opportunity to try to understand his newfound abilities and connect with a place of natural power, Erlinder and his allies returned to the mysterious grove of megaliths, known as the Shrine of the Agrestal Cycle, in the middle of the forest. It was here, upon visiting for the second time, that he first encountered Vyslos, along with Kahina and Tekas Woadsinger.

Of the three druids that communed with Erlinder that night, Vyslos appeared to be the elder sage and the druid most in tune with the spell-casting aspect of his order. After discussing the nature of his power, and possible avenues in which to harness it, Erlinder chose to speak with Vyslos at length in order to further his understanding of the nature of druidic magics.
Vyslos informed Erlinder that the grove he oversees is located in the shadow of the Jordanis Mountains, in a place called the Shambling Grove.

Kahina.name: Kahina
description: Kahina informed Erlinder that the grove she oversees is located in the state of Cebrin, in southern Ulfwyst.

Tekas-Woadsinger.name: Tekas Woadsinger
description: Tekas Woadsinger is a druid and member of the Sylvan Conclave. Having embraced the shape shifting aspect of his druidic powers, Tekas appears as a huge, hulking humanoid-bear hybrid. In this form, he stand roughly 8 feet (2.25m) tall, with the face of a bear, dark gray fur, and large, powerful claws.
Tekas informed Erlinder that the grove he oversees is located in the Desolate Wastes, in central Ulfwyst.

Baqrin-Calosh.name: Baqrin Calosh
description: Lord Baqrin Calosh is a noble lord and ruler of the city-state of Venbrin. He has a long list of titles, which include the 7th Lord of Venbrin, Master of the Argentate & Protector of the Commercia Concordis. A middle aged human man, he has mid-length silvery, platinum blond hair and a goatee comprised of a thin mustache and chin-beard. Lord Baqrin does not seem to take his titles too seriously, and can be found wandering the city of Venbrin without escort. He is good natured, with a broad smile and a welcoming presence. He tends to dress in fine clothing, but carries himself more like a swashbuckling duelist than the noble lord of a city-state.

Lord Baqrin keeps his home at the Argentate, a walled palace in the north east of the city. He frequently leaves Venbrin aboard his personal flagship, the Shining Dawn, to patrol the waters around Venbrin for threats to his city and the merchant trade in the region.

Janik-Malmor.name: Janik Malmor
description: Baron Janik Malmor is the baron of Frenkel. The baron is a vassal of Count Jeskin Sebroski and is charged with protecting the western border of Navolin from external threats. The baron's personal manor is Auburn Castle.

Many families live and work in the barony of Frenkel, including the Montajays, a halfling family of which Filibert Montajay was a member. Filibert was a subject of the baron until he was forced to leave the fortress in Sirngor of 2C 2573.

Nicolai-Valken.name: Nicolai Valken
description: Archduke Nicolai Valken is the current ruler of the Archduchy of Zurast.

Belthren-Ogni.name: Belthren Ogni
Belthren-Ogni.quote: "The biggest thing I killed? Do you know of Kaer Edsken on the border of Lemuria? It was just a ruin at the time, but back when I was an adventurer, I fought an adult red dragon there. We managed to kill the beast, but it cost me everything."
description: Belthren Ogni is the guild master of Ruby Phoenix and a former adventurer with, and last surviving member of, the legendary adventuring company 'The Ruby Drifters'.
